thread.title: Moto G5 to reportedly go on sale right after its unveiling this month
thread.title_full: Moto G5 to reportedly go on sale right after its unveiling this month

title: Moto G5 to reportedly go on sale right after its unveiling this month
text:
Moto G5 to reportedly go on sale right after its unveiling this... Moto G5 to reportedly go on sale right after its unveiling this month By - February 2, 2017 “The Moto G5 and G5 Plus are rumoured to go on sale after an unveiling at MWC” 
Lenovo recently sent out invites for its MWC event, which is scheduled for February 26th at Barcelona. At the event, the company is expected to unveil its next-gen Moto G series of smartphones. Ahead of the unveiling, we have already seen a couple of renders and live images of the upcoming Moto G5 and G5 Plus. Now, a gadget tipster on Twitter , Roland Quandt, suggests that the Moto G5 range will go on sale right after unveiling at MWC. Motorola Moto G5 will be in retail shortly after MWC launch it seems – this coming from a UK retailer. pic.twitter.com/Dcg3tVDDn1 — Roland Quandt (@rquandt) February 1, 2017 
The tipster has posted a photo that he claims to be coming from a UK retailer, which reveals a few details about the Moto G5 range. As per the source, the Moto G5 will come with 2GB of RAM and 16GB of internal memory. The first stocks of the handset will be available in mid-March, so we expect the pre-orders will begin in the first week of the month. 
The source suggests that the Moto G5 will also be available in a gold hue, which will be a first for the Moto G series. Earlier reports suggested that the Moto G5 and its Plus variant will be launched in India in March. Facebook Comments
